solution_line_template: They'll need to make an estimated {small_child_omelet_per} * {num_small_child} = <<{small_child_omelet_per}*{num_small_child}={small_child_omelets}>>{small_child_omelets} omelets for small children.
They'll need to make an estimated {older_child_omelet_per} * {num_older_child} = <<{older_child_omelet_per}*{num_older_child}={older_child_omelets}>>{older_child_omelets} omelets for older children.
They'll need to make an estimated {adult_omelet_per} * {num_adult} = <<{adult_omelet_per}*{num_adult}={adult_omelets}>>{adult_omelets} omelets for the adults.
And they'll need to make an estimated {senior_omelet_per} * {num_senior} = <<{senior_omelet_per}*{num_senior}={senior_omelets}>>{senior_omelets} omelets for the seniors.

Along with the {extra_omelets} extra omelets they'll make as a buffer, they will need enough eggs for {small_child_omelets} + {older_child_omelets} + {adult_omelets} + {senior_omelets} + {extra_omelets} = <<{small_child_omelets}+{older_child_omelets}+{adult_omelets}+{senior_omelets}+{extra_omelets}={total_omelets}>>{total_omelets} omelets.
